Secrets Maroma Beach Riviera Cancún: Complete Resort Guide

Mexico's Most Beautiful Beach Meets Adults-Only Luxury

Last updated: January 2025

Maroma Beach has been repeatedly voted one of the world's most beautiful beaches—and Secrets secured prime real estate. The adults-only resort combines AMResorts' polished formula with this exceptional beach, creating something special: reliable luxury where the natural setting does the heavy lifting. Waves lap gently on powdery white sand, palm trees provide natural shade, and the Caribbean shows off its impossible blues. The resort is excellent; the beach is extraordinary.

In This Guide

  • Accommodations
  • Dining
  • Maroma Beach
  • Pools & Activities
  • Secrets Spa by Pevonia

Overview & Vibe

{<strong>Beach-Forward Luxury:</strong></p><p>Secrets Maroma exists because of its beach. While other Secrets properties are excellent, this one has a natural advantage that elevates everything else.</p><p><strong>Key Stats:</strong></p><ul><li>412 suites</p><ul><li>Award-winning Maroma Beach</p><ul><li>7 restaurants</p><ul><li>5 bars</p><ul><li>Adults-only (18+)</p><ul><li>Unlimited-Luxury® all-inclusive</p><ul><li>Part of AMResorts family</p><p><strong>The Vibe:</strong></p><ul><li>Beach-centric (as it should be)</p><ul><li>Romantic and relaxed</p><ul><li>Upscale without pretension</p><ul><li>Social pool areas</p><ul><li>Quiet beach stretches available</p><p><strong>Two Tiers:</strong></p><p><strong>Standard Secrets Experience</strong></p><ul><li>All Unlimited-Luxury inclusions</p><ul><li>Full restaurant and bar access</p><ul><li>Quality spirits and wines</p><ul><li>Starting ~$700/night</p><p><strong>Preferred Club</strong></p><ul><li>Enhanced suites</p><ul><li>Exclusive pool and beach areas</p><ul><li>Premium spirits upgrade</p><ul><li>Priority everything</p><ul><li>Starting ~$900/night</p><p><strong>Who Stays Here:</strong></p><ul><li>Beach lovers (obviously)</p><ul><li>Couples seeking romance</p><ul><li>Honeymoons and anniversaries</p><ul><li>Secrets loyalists</p><ul><li>Those who prioritize beach over everything}

Accommodations

{<strong>Suite Categories:</strong></p><p><strong>Junior Suite Tropical View (from $700/night)</strong></p><ul><li>560 sq ft</p><ul><li>Garden/pool views</p><ul><li>Private balcony or terrace</p><ul><li>Jetted tub in bathroom</p><ul><li>King or two double beds</p><p><strong>Junior Suite Ocean View ($800-950)</strong></p><ul><li>560 sq ft</p><ul><li>Caribbean Sea views</p><ul><li>Same amenities</p><ul><li>Preferred floor locations</p><p><strong>Junior Suite Swim-Out ($950-1,100)</strong></p><ul><li>560 sq ft with pool access</p><ul><li>Step into pool from terrace</p><ul><li>Ground floor</p><ul><li>Limited availability</p><p><strong>Preferred Club Junior Suite ($900-1,100)</strong></p><ul><li>560 sq ft</p><ul><li>Preferred Club benefits</p><ul><li>Better locations</p><ul><li>Enhanced amenities</p><p><strong>Preferred Club Ocean Front Suite ($1,100-1,400)</strong></p><ul><li>850 sq ft</p><ul><li>Premium ocean views</p><ul><li>Living area</p><ul><li>All PC benefits</p><p><strong>Presidential Suite ($2,000+)</strong></p><ul><li>1,500+ sq ft</p><ul><li>Ultimate accommodation</p><ul><li>Private pool option</p><ul><li>Maximum everything</p><p><strong>All Suites Include:</strong></p><ul><li>Daily refreshed minibar</p><ul><li>Premium bath amenities</p><ul><li>Pillow menu</p><ul><li>24-hour room service</p><ul><li>Smart TV with streaming</p><ul><li>WiFi</p><ul><li>Turndown service}

Dining

{<strong>Seven Restaurants:</strong></p><p><strong>Bordeaux (French)</strong> Classic French cuisine with contemporary touches. Elegant atmosphere, prix fixe options, excellent wine list.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Reservations recommended</p><ul><li>Smart casual dress</p><p><strong>Himitsu (Asian)</strong> Pan-Asian with teppanyaki, sushi bar, and main dining. Theatrical cooking, fresh fish.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Teppanyaki reservation required</p><p><strong>Seaside Grill</strong> Beachfront seafood with Caribbean views. Fresh catches, lobster nights, ocean atmosphere. The setting alone makes it special.</p><ul><li>Lunch and dinner</p><ul><li>Most romantic dinner option</p><p><strong>Oceana (Seafood)</strong> Fresh seafood preparations, ceviches, and Caribbean flavors. Indoor fine dining.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Smart casual</p><p><strong>El Patio (Mexican)</strong> Regional Mexican in a courtyard setting. Traditional dishes, tequila pairings.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><p><strong>World Café</strong> All-day international dining. Breakfast buffet plus à la carte, lunch, casual dinner.</p><ul><li>Breakfast, lunch, dinner</p><ul><li>Casual</p><p><strong>Barefoot Grill</strong> Pool and beachside casual. Burgers, tacos, light fare. Perfect for swimwear dining.</p><ul><li>Lunch</p><ul><li>Very casual</p><p><strong>Room Service:</strong> 24-hour availability with full menu options.}

Maroma Beach

{<strong>The Star Attraction:</strong></p><p>Maroma Beach consistently ranks among the world's best beaches. The natural cove creates protected, calm waters ideal for swimming. White powder sand stretches in both directions.</p><p><strong>What Makes It Special:</strong></p><ul><li>Naturally protected cove</p><ul><li>Calm, clear Caribbean water</p><ul><li>Powdery white sand</p><ul><li>Less seaweed than some areas (cove protection)</p><ul><li>Dramatic palm tree backdrop</p><ul><li>Spectacular sunrise views</p><p><strong>Beach Amenities:</strong></p><ul><li>Unlimited loungers and umbrellas</p><ul><li>Full food and beverage service</p><ul><li>Beach beds (first-come basis)</p><ul><li>Towels and sunscreen</p><ul><li>Beach butlers</p><ul><li>Water sports center</p><p><strong>Preferred Club Beach:</strong></p><ul><li>Dedicated section</p><ul><li>Enhanced service</p><ul><li>Premium loungers</p><ul><li>Priority beach bed access</p><p><strong>Water Sports (Included):</strong></p><ul><li>Kayaking</p><ul><li>Paddle boarding</p><ul><li>Snorkeling (equipment provided)</p><ul><li>Sailing (small craft)</p><p><strong>Beach Tips:</strong></p><ul><li>Sunrise from the beach is spectacular</p><ul><li>Walk south for quieter stretches</p><ul><li>Beach beds claimed early (7-8am peak)</p><ul><li>Preferred Club has advantage for beds}

Pools & Activities

{<strong>Pool Areas:</strong></p><p><strong>Main Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Large infinity pool</p><ul><li>Swim-up bar</p><ul><li>Active atmosphere during day</p><ul><li>Full service</p><p><strong>Quiet Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Adults seeking relaxation</p><ul><li>Less activity</p><ul><li>Same service level</p><p><strong>Preferred Club Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Exclusive to PC guests</p><ul><li>Smaller, uncrowded</p><ul><li>Premium service</p><p><strong>Activities Included:</strong></p><ul><li>Daily fitness classes</p><ul><li>Yoga on the beach</p><ul><li>Water aerobics</p><ul><li>Cooking classes</p><ul><li>Dance lessons</p><ul><li>Tequila tastings</p><ul><li>Non-motorized water sports</p><ul><li>Tennis</p><ul><li>Beach volleyball</p><p><strong>Evening Entertainment:</strong></p><ul><li>Live music at bars</p><ul><li>Theme nights</p><ul><li>Shows (varies)</p><ul><li>Fire dancers</p><ul><li>Lobby bar scene</p><p><strong>Excursions (Extra):</strong></p><ul><li>Cenote tours</p><ul><li>Tulum/Cobá ruins</p><ul><li>Cozumel day trips</p><ul><li>Whale shark swimming (seasonal)</p><ul><li>Jungle adventures}

Secrets Spa by Pevonia

{<strong>Full-Service Spa:</strong></p><p>The spa offers comprehensive treatments using Pevonia products. Not included in all-inclusive rate.</p><p><strong>Facilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Treatment rooms</p><ul><li>Couples suites</p><ul><li>Hydrotherapy circuit</p><ul><li>Steam and sauna</p><ul><li>Relaxation lounge</p><ul><li>Beauty salon</p><ul><li>Fitness center</p><p><strong>Popular Treatments:</strong></p><p><strong>Pevonia Signature Facial (60 min, $150)</strong> Customized facial with Pevonia products.</p><p><strong>Couple's Massage (60 min, $280)</strong> Side-by-side relaxation.</p><p><strong>Hot Stone (80 min, $180)</strong> Heated stone massage therapy.</p><p><strong>Body Wrap (60 min, $150)</strong> Detoxifying or hydrating options.</p><p><strong>Fitness Center:</strong></p><ul><li>Modern equipment</p><ul><li>24-hour access</p><ul><li>Ocean views</p><ul><li>Personal training available}

Preferred Club Benefits

{<strong>Is the Upgrade Worth It?</strong></p><p>Preferred Club adds approximately $200/night. Here's what you get:</p><p><strong>Exclusive Access:</strong></p><ul><li>PC pool area (uncrowded)</p><ul><li>PC beach section (priority beds)</p><ul><li>Preferred Club lounge (snacks, drinks)</p><p><strong>Enhanced Service:</strong></p><ul><li>Priority restaurant reservations</p><ul><li>Late checkout when available</p><ul><li>Preferred check-in</p><ul><li>Dedicated concierge</p><p><strong>Room Upgrades:</strong></p><ul><li>Better suite locations</p><ul><li>Enhanced amenities</p><ul><li>Upgraded minibar</p><p><strong>The Verdict:</strong></p><p><strong>Worth it if:</strong></p><ul><li>You want guaranteed beach bed access</p><ul><li>Exclusive pool areas matter</p><ul><li>You value priority reservations</p><ul><li>It's a special occasion</p><p><strong>Skip it if:</strong></p><ul><li>You're early risers (get beach beds anyway)</p><ul><li>Budget is tight</p><ul><li>Short stay (3 nights or less)</p><ul><li>You don't care about exclusivity}

Practical Information

{<strong>Getting There:</strong></p><ul><li>Cancún Airport (CUN): 35-45 minutes</p><ul><li>Transfer: Included with packages or ~$100 round trip</p><ul><li>Playa del Carmen: 20 minutes south</p><ul><li>Tulum: 45 minutes south</p><p><strong>Location:</strong> Maroma Beach sits between Cancún and Playa del Carmen—convenient to both but not walkable to either. You're coming for the beach, not the location.</p><p><strong>What's Included (Unlimited-Luxury):</strong></p><ul><li>All meals (7 restaurants)</p><ul><li>Premium spirits and wines by glass</p><ul><li>Room service 24/7</p><ul><li>Daily refreshed minibar</p><ul><li>Non-motorized water sports</p><ul><li>Fitness classes</p><ul><li>Entertainment</p><ul><li>WiFi</p><ul><li>Gratuities</p><p><strong>What Costs Extra:</strong></p><ul><li>Spa treatments</p><ul><li>Excursions</p><ul><li>Premium wine bottles</p><ul><li>Motorized water sports</p><ul><li>Golf (nearby courses)</p><p><strong>Dress Codes:</strong></p><ul><li>Bordeaux, Himitsu: Smart casual (no shorts)</p><ul><li>Other dinner venues: Resort casual</p><ul><li>No swimwear in restaurants (cover required)}

Pros & Cons

{<strong>Why Choose Secrets Maroma:</strong></p><p>✅ <strong>Pros:</strong></p><ul><li>Maroma Beach is genuinely exceptional</p><ul><li>Protected cove means calmer water</p><ul><li>Adults-only romantic atmosphere</p><ul><li>Reliable Secrets quality</p><ul><li>Good restaurants, especially Seaside Grill</p><ul><li>Swim-out suites available</p><ul><li>Reasonable pricing for quality</p><ul><li>Well-run, consistent experience</p><p>❌ <strong>Cons:</strong></p><ul><li>Not in a walkable location</p><ul><li>Large property (400+ suites)</p><ul><li>Beach beds competitive at peak times</p><ul><li>Some restaurants inconsistent</p><ul><li>Spa costs extra</p><ul><li>Not the newest property</p><ul><li>Pool areas can feel crowded</p><ul><li>Seaweed still possible (though less than some)</p><p><strong>Compared to Alternatives:</strong></p><ul><li>vs. Excellence: Similar quality; Maroma Beach is the differentiator</p><ul><li>vs. Zoëtry: Secrets larger and more social; Zoëtry more intimate</p><ul><li>vs. UNICO: UNICO more design-forward; Maroma has better beach</p><ul><li>vs. Secrets Riviera Cancún: Maroma wins on beach alone}

Booking Tips

{<strong>How to Book:</strong></p><p><strong>Best Approaches:</strong></p><ol><li>Costco Travel (excellent packages)</p><ol><li>Direct AMResorts site for promotions</p><ol><li>Compare all-in pricing across platforms</p><ol><li>Travel agent for honeymoon extras</p><p><strong>Room Selection:</strong></p><ul><li>Ocean View: Best value with view</p><ul><li>Swim-Out: Great for honeymooners</p><ul><li>Preferred Club: If beach bed priority matters</p><ul><li>Avoid: Tropical View unless budget requires</p><p><strong>Beach Bed Strategy:</strong></p><ul><li>Early morning (7-8am) for prime spots</p><ul><li>Preferred Club has dedicated section</p><ul><li>South end of beach is quieter</p><ul><li>Afternoon frees up as guests leave</p><p><strong>Restaurant Tips:</strong></p><ul><li>Book Bordeaux and Himitsu first</p><ul><li>Seaside Grill for romantic dinner (no reservation)</p><ul><li>Breakfast à la carte at World Café</p><ul><li>Room service when you want privacy</p><p><strong>Best Value Timing:</strong></p><ul><li>May-June: 30-40% off peak</p><ul><li>November: Shoulder season deals</p><ul><li>Avoid: Christmas/New Year (packed, expensive)</p><ul><li>Book: 2-3 months ahead for good rates}

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Maroma Beach really as good as they say?

Yes—it's genuinely one of Mexico's best beaches. The protected cove creates calm, clear water ideal for swimming. The sand is powder-white, the palms are picturesque, and the overall setting is exceptional. The beach alone justifies choosing this Secrets over others.

How does Secrets Maroma compare to other Secrets properties?

Maroma wins on beach quality—no other Secrets property matches it. Secrets Moxché is newer, Secrets The Vine has Hotel Zone access, and Secrets Riviera Cancún is larger. But if beach is your priority, Maroma is the clear choice.

Do I need Preferred Club for a good beach experience?

Not necessarily. PC guarantees beach bed access, but early risers get beds anyway. If you're planning to sleep in and still want prime beach spots, PC helps. If you're up by 8am, standard experience is fine.

Is Secrets Maroma good for honeymoons?

Excellent choice. The beach is romantic, swim-out suites are special, and the adults-only atmosphere is sophisticated. It's not the most intimate property (400+ suites), but the setting and service deliver for honeymoons.

What about seaweed at Maroma Beach?

The protected cove helps reduce seaweed accumulation compared to open beaches. It's not immune—sargassum can appear anywhere in the Caribbean—but Maroma typically fares better. Check recent reviews for current conditions.
